intro: Galactites mutabilis, commonly known as the variable milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on environmental conditions. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds known for their milky sap. Galactites mutabilis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
